title: Search filter improvement
author: MikaHuttunen
body_snippet:
I have imported computer items from root of our Active Directory and we have many different OU's where computer objects are located.

I would like to search and find(filter) all result from the imported connection tree without expanding all of the folders.

So this is the wanted behaviour and it would make our life much easier:
https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues/338#issuecomment-345527562

iterations.description: Users with large AD-imported trees need search to find connections inside collapsed folders without manually expanding all nodes first

comments.author: jerico99
comments.snippet: I would definitely like to see a search mode like this also. The way it is now is very finicky.

comments.author: remizik
comments.snippet:
Hi, yes please.
The search filed at the bottom left should filter, not expand everything and select the 1st item fitting the search string.
Thanks !

comments.author: Freealx
comments.snippet:
I would add my vote for such a useful feature.
This is one of the things that SecureCRT is making better - they do not support pattern or regex in the search though.
The capability to see for all your folders in the tree ONLY all matched lines for a search pattern or a regex will be great improvement of that wonderful manager!

comments.author: PetbkA
comments.snippet:
I guess the best behavior is to:
1. Show filter results with folder structure. E.g. if you've found _Servers → Windows 2022_ and _Clients → Windows 10_, the result should be
    ```
    Connections
        Servers
            Windows 2022
        Clients
            Windows 10
    ```
    , but not
    ```
        Windows 2022
        Windows 10
    ```
2. Filter through connections in all folders, even if some folders aren't expanded;
3. Return collapsed/expanded folder states af...

notes:
AI triage (claude): Users with large AD-imported trees need search to find connections inside collapsed folders without manually expanding all nodes first
Approach: Ensure the TreeListView filter traverses all children recursively (even collapsed branches) when filtering. The ObjectListView TreeListView already walks the model tree for filtering — verify CanExpandGetter and the model enumeration include collapsed nodes. If not, override the filtering to flatten and search all descendants, then show matching items with their parent chain expanded.
